section: A. The Members wish to enter into an association of mutual benefit and agree to jointly invest and set up a joint venture enterprise. B. This Agreement sets out the terms and conditions governing this association.
explanation: This is an example of a structural flaw, where the introduction to the agreement is vague and does not make sense. There is no clear declaration of the purpose, scope, or intent of the joint venture.

section: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.
explanation: This section suffers from a structural flaw. The sentence structure is broken, and the capitalization is inconsistent. This makes the definition of the Venture's purpose unclear and unprofessional.

section: Capital Contributions 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section contains misaligned terminology. The agreed value of $3,500,000.00 is assigned to both BorrowMoney.com, inc. and JVLS, LLC, despite JVLS, LLC also contributing an additional 10% of any generated gross revenue. This creates an inconsistency in how the total contributions are valued and could lead to disputes regarding each member's share in the Venture.
